verb.description: (of a judge or court) subject (a plaintiff) to the stoppage of their suit on the grounds of failure to make a legal case or bring sufficient evidence.
examples: another action where the plaintiff has been nonsuited

noun.description: A court-ordered stoppage of a suit on the grounds that the plaintiff has failed to make a legal case or bring sufficient evidence.

origin: Late Middle English (as a noun): from Anglo-Norman French, literally not pursuing (see non-, suit).
